column4: how can i find the com port number of my usb port to which my device is connected? it shows my device in lsusb and dmesg
is a usb to serial converter??
what type of device is the one you are talking about ?
dmesg should tell you the /dev/ttyUSBx it gets
yes. but i want the com port number. is tht com port number?
but my software wants com port number
o.0 how is a webcam software supposed to work with a mobile phone ???
its like that. i just have to enter the com port number. it works in windows though
i do not think you can make a mobie phone act as webcam in linux. at least i do not know how
i just wanted to know if there was a way to find the com port number?
in linux "com port number" does not make any sense. that's a DOS (windows) concept
in linux you have device nodes/files
